title: Short-Intensive Foundational Engineering Mechanics Course Based on Augmented Reality

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding Basic Physics and Mathematics Concepts (Force, Velocity, Acceleration, etc.)
context.additional_context: Students freely explore AR content via digital devices; though physical learning spaces are limited, mobile-optimized content is provided.

learning_goals: Learners can apply methods for interpreting structures in static equilibrium states with over 85% accuracy via AR simulation.
Learners can explain at least three material mechanical properties by analyzing virtual force-strain experiment results.
Learners can visually represent the process of solving mechanics problems within 5 minutes using mobile-based AR modules.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
